radiographic_examinations.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears diffusely echogenic. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. The CBD measures 5 mm. There is a 2.5 cm shadowing stone within the lumen of the gallbladder which is distended but otherwise unremarkable without pericholecystic fluid or wall thickening. The pancreas is not well visualized due to overlying bowel gas. The spleen has normal echogenicity, measuring 11.1 cm. The right and left kidneys measure 12.2 cm and 12.7 cm respectively, with normal cortical echogenicity and corticomedullary differentiation. No evidence of masses, stones, or hydronephrosis in the kidneys. Visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal limits.
